question: Which of the following is true regarding seismic waves?
option1: These travel through the solid parts of the earth only
option2: These travel through the solid as well as other parts of the earth
option3: These spread on the surface of the earth
answer: These travel through the solid parts of the earth only
explanation: Seismic waves that vibrate perpendicular to the direction of their path depend upon a resistance to transverse or \"shear\" force which does not exist in a liquid or gas medium, so they can only travel in the solid parts of the Earth. P waves in air are simply sound waves and the speed of sound is around 340 m/s for ordinary temperatures.
